intro: Stachys dasyanthes, commonly known as the woolly betony, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and spikes of purple or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is often found in dry, coastal environments. Stachys dasyanthes is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
